“Right gentlemen, for your hard work, I am allowing you to take a few days rest to do what you want, as well as having new equipment”.

After finishing their drinks, Lt. Stantham bought the next round of drinks for them.

“Now I understand Mr Constansa that you were looking for something within your ship. What was it?”

“Well sir, it was the computer’s reserve power unit. I wonder if I lost it when we [the fighters] took out the dud VRU Corvette. I had it before the mission, but after taking the Corvette down, it had gone missing”.

Jason had not been able to find it when he jumped out of the cockpit. As it was, there was valuable tactical and ship information on the reserve thankfully could not be accessed without the power unit. As it was, a replacement part had been located. All Jason had to do was to hook up the unit to the computer and hope it works.

After about 3-4 hours in the bar, the pilots and Lt. Stantham left. As the rest of the pilots headed for their rooms, Jason had visited the armoury and picked up the replacement. He then headed to his Piranha. Activating the reserve computer would require the help of power from the reserve engines.

Engaging the reserve engines, Jason placed the new part into the computer unit. All of a sudden, the reserve computer had finished configuring and calibrating the new part and now it could now reboot. After a few seconds, the computer sprung into life. Jason could now shut off the reserve engines. The computer still functioned properly, despite there not being any power from the engines.

Turning off the computer, Jason quickly jumped out of the cockpit and headed towards his quarters.

The night went by slowly. As it progressed, Jason started to become restless, so to prevent himself getting bored, he decided to listen to his favourite music.

The next morning, Jason and the rest of the pilots headed down to the mess hall for their early meal.

The next few hours were spent relaxing and chilling.
1112222211121.title: The wing has to fight more aliens

choices: The wing becomes restless
11122222111211.content:
Two weeks went by without any fighting. All of the pilots needed something to do so they found something to entertain themselves for a while. They decided to turn themselves into sportsmen for a while.

The main sport that all of the pilots used to watch during their childhood was motorsport. As it was, they all wondered what it was like to be in the shoes of a racing drive.

So, they pursued that theory and placed themselves in the footsteps of their idols. Being of English heritage, Jason decided to be a British racing driver.

His idol was none other than Jenson Button (2009 F1 world Champion). All of the other pilots decided that they would be their respected drivers from the same sport.

They all voted on where to have the race. They all chose that the race would take place at Silverstone racing circuit in England (although the pilots were in another part of space, they could recreate the race that they had watched many years ago).

The race lasted about 2 hours, by that time; the pilots were having too much fun to notice that one of the Goliath pilots had been given a notice. After 2 hours, the result of the race was:

1. Rob- as Mark Webber
2. Charlie- as Bruno Senna
3. Jason- as Jenson Button
4. Zach- as Lewis Hamilton
5. Chris- as Sebastian Vettel
6. James- as Fernando Alonso
7. Michael- as Felipe Massa
8. Janick- as Kimi Raikkonen

The remaining drivers did not bother about their race position. They just had fun, which to them, was the best way to think in events like this. They did not care who won and who lost; they just wanted to have fun.

Brian, the Goliath pilot walked in with the notice. It was another mission.

The whole of the 63rd Lowers Wing were to infiltrate and destroy Allesan 3 (pronounced All-I-Sarn), a pirate base well known for harbouring an elite group of space pirates. These pirates were ruthless. They had no respect for anybody else. They would annihilate anybody that tried to stop them. They simply decimated the entire Uppers quadrant before making their way to the Lowers quadrant. They would stop at nothing until they had reclaimed everything that they had lost when they were being repelled many centuries ago.

The only way to attack the base was to launch a nuclear assault against it as the pirates wanted revenge for what had happened to their forefathers.

The base had allsorts of various ships, from fighters to bombers (also used as kamikaze ships) and heavy battalion cruisers.

They were protected by a group of aliens known as Vagrants. The Vagrants had basic weapons, but they packed one hell of a punch. If anybody strayed into their territory, they would seek down that ship and obliterate it before it could retreat. Like the pirates, the Vagrants were a ruthless race who had no respect for anybody.

Could nothing stop the Vagrants or the pirates?

Meanwhile, back at base, the pilots found their respective ships and engaged the engines. Each pilot had no idea what Lt. Stantham had done to their ships. They called up their schematics for their own ships and found out what upgrades had been installed.

The Goliaths had a new design to them, while the fighters had highly advanced weaponry to show their aggression against the Vagrants. Could anybody stop the EIC when they got going? To help them with their mission, Lt. Stantham also installed advanced computers so that the pilots could feel at home with their favourite music playing. As it was, Lt. Stantham had checked through the bio for each pilot and decided that they would have whatever they liked played through the computer. Most of pilots listened to rock music, while Jason, Charlie, Rob and Zach listened to bands such as Pendulum, (particularly songs from all of their albums; Hold Your Colour, In Silico and Immersion). However, to help them focus on their mission, they had bands from different metal/ rock genres and post-hardcore.

By the time the 63rd Lowers had reached the invasion gate, Lt. Stantham had joined them in a heavily armed ‘almost flying tank-like’ Diminisher super cruiser.

They all activated their jump engines for the jump to the pirate world. By the time they reached the battlefield, there were swarms of Vagrants in the vicinity ready to destroy them. These alien drones fired their primary weaponry, but the EIC ships retaliated in a violent way. The battle with the first wave was long and hard. But that was only part of the obstacle. The Vagrants turned their attention to Lt. Stantham’s Diminisher. They opened fire with everything that they had. The ship was taking hits, but they were only against the shields.

The Diminisher shook under the vibrations. More Vagrant vessels arrived and opened fire. The Diminisher fought back. Firing its defensive cannons, Vagrants were falling left right and centre.

Unfortunately, more Vagrant ships arrived and the Diminisher had no other defence against the armada of ships. Hailing Jason and the Goliath pilots, they turned round ready to defend the Diminisher from the Vagrants. Giving the Vagrants hell was easier said than done. Those ships were well armoured.

The Goliath pilots led the Vagrants away, right into the path of Jason. Firing everything that they had, the Vagrants failed to even hit Jason’s shielding.

After about 35 minutes of continuous fire, the Vagrant ships had run out of ammo. It was now Jason’s turn to strike fear into the Vagrant ranks. While all of this was going on, the pirates were preparing for a massive combat mission in order to protect their home.

As the pirates prepared, Jason and his fellow Goliath pilots struck fear into the drones and placed the pirates under pressure as their defence had been knocked out. The Diminisher was still in the fight, but it had lost some of its defensive armament. This did not worry Lt. Stantham. He knew that his pilots would be the ones to finally stop the pirates from expanding their territory.

After about 30 minutes flying, the ships reached the pirates’ base. They noticed that the base was shielded. There was no shielding on the mast of the base. This would the prime target for an assault. Some of the fighters flew up with the bombers for their attack.

Dropping their payloads, the bombers retreated as the fighters fired nuclear warheads into the centre shaft to cause the explosion to become greater than it would have been on its own if it was just the bombs that detonated.

Allesan 3 shook violently and then erupted. It was now starting to implode.

The implosions caused pressure to build up within the main sector. This pressure eventually became so great; it caused the implosions to shift outwards. The base was now nothing more than one huge fireball in space.

With no other way back, the pilots had to resort to their advanced jump CPU units to get them back home.

After jumping back home having destroyed Allesan 3, the pilots now enjoyed time to reflect on the mission and look forward to missions in the future.

The guys headed down to the bar along with Lt. Stantham who thanked Jason, Rob and the other Goliath pilots for defending him.

They spent most of the night drinking, chatting and joking. This was the first time that Lt. Stantham had been on a mission with his pilots.

He saw first hand how accurate the bombers were and how accurate the fighters were when they released their nuclear warheads.

He also saw how Jason and his fellow pilots came to the rescue of their CO when he was in trouble.

A small conversation about the mission soon started.

“Do you do that often?”

“Do what sir?

“Help out a fellow pilot who is in trouble?

“Yes sir, we do”

“I’m impressed with your teamwork, as well as how accurate the bombers and the fighters were when releasing their payloads”.

The pilots did not know what to think.

Then all of a sudden, Zach was asked how they could become so accurate. The reply that Lt. Stantham got pleased him even more.

Zach had told Lt. Stantham that the reason that the fighters and bombers were so accurate was because they had been working on their accuracy in both firing and bombing ranges.
11122222111211.title: The pilots spend time doing nothing

choices: The dropship is ambushed after dropping out of hypersonic
111222221112111.content:
Another week went by without any fighting. The 63rd Lowers Wing pilots were getting extremely restless.

After the week had gone by, Jason received a new mission notice. He was to join two other pilots who had volunteered their services to shut down a drill that had been used to mine valuable resources.

However, to shut the drill down, Jason and his fellow pilots would have to drop from a small dropship above the planet’s surface.

As they prepared their suits for the jump, Lt. Stantham arrives in the hangar “Good luck men. Whatever happens out there, I would like to say that you three are the bravest and best fighting men that ever stepped in to an EIC uniform”.

Saluting the pilots, Lt. Stantham left the hangar while Jason and his fellow soldiers put the final touches to their suits. One of the most senior pilots was responsible for the explosive charges. Mission control on the base was aware of the mission; however, the only way to stay in touch with them was through in suit communication links.

As the dropship prepared itself for the mission, the weapons were being loaded with ammunition just in case it was to encounter any hostile alien ship.

The pilot’s jumpsuits were equipped with extra compartments for the charges as well as any other equipment as well as one weapon compartment for any enemies that were required for the mission. The suits also contained self-retracting and self-packing parachutes. These parachutes would be used when the pilots were 4,500ft above the drill platform.

As the dropship arrived over the target, the pilots donned their helmets for the jump. After the pilots were ready, they were dropped into the planet’s atmosphere.

As the pilots descended, the dropship left the upper atmosphere. Once they were within 4,500ft of the platform, the parachutes deployed. Slowing down at a rapid rate caused a bit of pain for everybody, but the pain was only the initial shock of the rapid deceleration.

However, the pain subsided after a few minutes. The pilots then shook the pain off and continued with their mission.

Landing on the platform, Jason had a perfect opportunity to call the others in. However, the parachute on Ulrichsson’s suit had not deployed properly until it was too late. Although he had managed to land on the platform, the velocity at which he was travelling was enough to cause Ulrichsson to fall off the edge and smash against the base of the platform, face first. Glass from his helmet flew everywhere. Some of the smaller shards hit him in the face. He was now hurtling towards the ground, FAST.

His only chance of surviving the incident was Olan. Olan was the other pilot that volunteered for this mission. He had called for emergency assistance for Ulrichsson. The dropship arrived back over the planet’s surface and locked onto Ulrichsson and bought him back aboard, where a medical ship was waiting in the cargo bay ready to take Ulrichsson back to base.

After receiving Ulrichsson, the medical ship jumped back to where the base was located.

Meanwhile, back on the drill platform, Olan and Jason had to deal with enemy soldiers. As Jason was fighting one of the soldiers, another one opened fire on him.

The slug narrowly missed his head. However, the round hit the shooter’s comrade in the chest. This caused the soldier to fall off the platform and the soldier hurtled to the ground. After dispatching the soldier that Olan was fighting, a fire fight broke out.

Bullets zipped across the platform until the soldier was killed with a single laser round to the head. Slumping to the ground, the alien was pushed off of the platform. Picking up the rifle that the alien had dropped, Olan took a shot at the mechanism that was driving the drill. However, nothing happened. The only way to destroy the mechanism and the drill was with explosives. Ulrichsson was responsible for the explosives, but as he had been taken to hospital, there was no way to destroy the mechanism.

Or was there?


It turns out that the suits had small charges in them as well. This gave Jason an idea.

“Hey Olan, check your suit”.

“Why?” Olan asked.

“I just remembered something. These suits also have small explosive charges in them”.

Placing the charges, Olan and Jason knew that to stop the drill, they would need to consider the location of the explosives relative to that of the mechanism and the fuel line that was driving the drill (basically placing the charges close to the mechanism).

Knowing the exact location of the fuel line and the mechanism allowed easy access for the explosives.

Calling in the dropship once more, Olan and Jason beamed back aboard and then detonated the charges. Explosions ripped apart the drill.

Just as the dropship got clear of the atmosphere, ships surrounded it and started firing. Within minutes, EIC fighters arrived on the scene. One of them was Charlie in his Vengeance Lightning (sometimes known as the Tempest, the Vengeance Lightning is an upgraded version of the standard Vengeance that allows a pilot to activate the ‘afterburner’ capability that allows them to get involved in combat quicker). Charlie quickly destroyed the alien ships while the other fighters dealt with the other alien ships.

“What the hell is that?” the dropship pilot shouted. The drill was connected to a huge alien cargo ship, escorted by alien fighters and corvettes.

Destroying the cargo ship was too hard for the fighters to do on their own, so they called in their cruisers and bombers.

The corvettes were easy enough to destroy for the fighters to destroy. The cruisers and bombers (armed with sub-atomic rockets and nuclear missiles instead of bombs) arrived quickly and launched hit-and-run attacks on the cargo ship.

After 90 minutes of constant attacks, the cargo ship was severely damaged and the ships had run out of ammo.

The dropship put the final nail in the coffin as it launched 2 plasma torpedoes and 2 volleys of RSB-50 ammo into the heart of the cargo ship.

The ship erupted and the shockwave rocked the dropship. Turning round to the pilot, Olan asks, “Do you think we will be able to take much more of this?”

The pilot replied “At this rate, these shockwaves could rip us apart. Even with shields up, we would not stand a chance”.

The dropship accelerated from its current speed to speeds exceeding hypersonic. It disappeared in a flash of light. Still the shockwaves occurred, but the dropship was well away from the waves.
111222221112111.title: The wing becomes restless

choices: Jason and Olan let their comrade rest
1112222211121111.content:
As the ship dropped out of hypersonic, they were greeted by a small squadron of VRU fighters. The fighters started shooting at the huge dropship, only to have PLD-3 (PLD stands for Plasma Laser Discharge) rockets fired back at them from the dropship. Some of the fighters had been destroyed and some of them had been damaged.

3 rockets were fired from a broadside rocket launcher on a VRU Nostromo fighter. The rockets hit the dropship’s shields. However, the dropship did not even wobble slightly. Arming its 5 Hellstorm launchers with ECO-10 and HSTRM-02 rockets, the dropship locked onto two hidden ships.

The explosions from the detonating rockets had un-cloaked the hidden fighters. All of a sudden, a small battalion of the EIC’s new Hellfire cruisers obliterated the fighters.

After the fight, the Hellfire cruisers disappeared and the dropship flew back to the jump gate.

“What the fuck were those things?” Olan asked Jason.

Jason replied, “To be honest, I have no idea. Whatever the hell they are, they were ours”.

Olan looked puzzled. The pilot turned to Jason and Olan and said, “Those ships you saw are our new Hellfire heavy mega cruisers”.

“So that’s what they were then”.

“I guess so”.

Returning to the EIC’s base planet of Estriola 8, the dropship released Olan and Jason.

Meanwhile, in the transporter room of the EIC main base, the chief engineer locked onto Olan and Jason. Within seconds, they were back on the EIC base.

Lt. Stantham was also in the transporter room when Jason and Olan emerged.

“Congratulations gentlemen, you’ve done it again. You’ve once again shown that EIC are the best in this war. Keep it up”.

“Thank you sir” Jason and Olan responded and saluted him as Lt Stantham left the room.

Heading straight for the medical wing, Jason and Olan were keen to know how Ulrichsson was after his accident on the mission.

One of the nurses came to the doorway as Jason and Olan arrived.

The nurse kindly asked “May I help you two gentlemen?”

Olan replied “Yes ma’am. We are keen to know how our comrade is. Are we allowed to see him ma’am?”

“The pilot who arrived here arrived here with bad injuries from glass shattering in his face whilst on a mission?”

“Yes ma’am” Olan replied. “Is he alive?”

The nurse replied, “I’ve got good news and I’ve got bad news. The good news is that your comrade is alive and in a stable condition. The bad news is that he will not be able to join you on missions as one of his facial nerves was badly damaged. We won’t know the full extent of the damage until he comes out of surgery. Had he been bought in later, he probably would not have survived. If he did survive, he would probably be permanently paralyzed”.

“Thank you ma’am” Jason said to the nurse.

“I’ll let him know that you two wanted to talk to him when he comes around from the anaesthetic”.

Leaving the ward, Olan could breathe a sigh of relief knowing that Ulrichsson had survived from his horrific ordeal.

After two hours, Ulrichsson had returned from surgery. One of the nurses let Jason and Olan know that their comrade was back from surgery. They went down to see him. He was still under anaesthetic.

Eventually, Ulrichsson came round. He smiled at Jason and Ulrichsson and in his native language whispered, “Hur är ni? Hur gick uppdraget vägen? Gick det bra? (How are you guys? How did the mission go? Did it go well?)”

Jason replied in Swedish “Det är bra att höra dig. Vi är glad att du är vid liv. Uppdraget var en stor framgång. Vi hade en grov skjuts hem ändå”. In English, that translates to “It's good to hear you. We're glad you're alive. The mission was a huge success. We had a rough ride home though.”

A small chuckle from Ulrichsson made Jason and Olan glad that they saved his life. To hear that the mission had been accomplished made Ulrichsson smile with joy. However, deep down, he was full of despair as he felt that he had let the side down after his accident. He felt like he had hampered the mission by not finishing the job off with his comrades.

What else could he do when he was unconscious and hurtling towards the ground at a rapid pace?

“I’m sorry for letting you guys down” Ulrichsson said.

“What the fuck have you got to be sorry about? It was an accident. Accidents happen all of the time. We’re just lucky that Olan was around to call for backup when he did” Jason replied.

The nurse came back into the room.

“Mr Ulrichsson, it seems that the damage to your facial nerve was not as bad as we first thought when you first came here. Your nerve should be more efficient if not perfect within a few months. For now, just rest and get stronger.”
